body:
Like others have said, "cis" and "trans" come from Latin. The idea is that if you're "transgender", you "identify" as a gender that's different from ("on the other side of") your sex, and if you're "cisgender", your gender is the same as ("on the same side as") your sex.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Like others have said, "cis" and "trans" come from Latin. The idea is that if you're "transgender", you "identify" as a gender that's different from ("on the other side of") your sex, and if you're "cisgender", your gender is the same as ("on the same side as") your sex.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

post.body:
Like for the love of absolute god....I'm not trying to be an asshole on this guild, but I can't stand when people use that term. It bothers me because they make it seem like there more than just male and female.

Like what the fuck is even a "cis"? If you're a male, then you're just a male! If you're female, then you're just fucking female! God, why do these insane people always have to make such simply things so complicated for no reason?

Sorry for raging, it's just so annoying having to feel like you need to justify and explain your basic anatomy, and your sexual preferences...like what more is there? 

Like if I say I'm attracted to both male, and female, is that supposed to mean I'm attracted to some....I don't even know and I probably shouldn't be trying to understand crazy. But then, if I say I'm attracted to "cis" men, and "cis" female somehow that finally mean I'm into actual males, and females?

I feel like it's just another thing to destroy the ideal of being bi/gay/straight.
post.body_html:
Like for the love of absolute god....I'm not trying to be an asshole on this guild, but I can't stand when people use that term. It bothers me because they make it seem like there more than just male and female.

Like what the fuck is even a "cis"? If you're a male, then you're just a male! If you're female, then you're just fucking female! God, why do these insane people always have to make such simply things so complicated for no reason?

Sorry for raging, it's just so annoying having to feel like you need to justify and explain your basic anatomy, and your sexual preferences...like what more is there?

Like if I say I'm attracted to both male, and female, is that supposed to mean I'm attracted to some....I don't even know and I probably shouldn't be trying to understand crazy. But then, if I say I'm attracted to "cis" men, and "cis" female somehow that finally mean I'm into actual males, and females?

I feel like it's just another thing to destroy the ideal of being bi/gay/straight.
post.title: I'm so fucking sick and tired of hearing people use the term "Cis".

guild.description:
Your guild for discussing all things trans.

**RULES**

Rulebreaking will lead to kicks, repeated rulebreaking will lead to a ban.

1. **No hate speech.** This is not limited to trans- and enbyphobia, and does include slurs.

2. **No shitposting.** High-effort memes, comics and artwork are welcome.

3. **Keep things relevant.** Posts should be about being trans or non-binary, or related to it.

4. **Stay posi!** Harrassment and bullying are not tolerated here, and will not be. Please don't put yourself down for any reason, you're all wonderful.

5. **Please no NSFW content.** Discussions about top or bottom surgery and sexual health do not count under this.

6. **Use appropriate warnings for sensitive subjects.** Overly triggering topics should be marked with a Content Warning (CW) like so:

CW: Bread

Today I baked a loaf of bread. It smelled very good and I sliced it up to make some toast
guild.description_html:
Your guild for discussing all things trans.

RULES

Rulebreaking will lead to kicks, repeated rulebreaking will lead to a ban.

  1. No hate speech. This is not limited to trans- and enbyphobia, and does include slurs.

  2. No shitposting. High-effort memes, comics and artwork are welcome.

  3. Keep things relevant. Posts should be about being trans or non-binary, or related to it.

  4. Stay posi! Harrassment and bullying are not tolerated here, and will not be. Please don't put yourself down for any reason, you're all wonderful.

  5. Please no NSFW content. Discussions about top or bottom surgery and sexual health do not count under this.

  6. Use appropriate warnings for sensitive subjects. Overly triggering topics should be marked with a Content Warning (CW) like so:

CW: Bread

Today I baked a loaf of bread. It smelled very good and I sliced it up to make some toast
guild.name: trans

parent.body:
the bread thing was an example lol. rules 3 and 4 are basically limited to posts, not comments, and rule 4 is basically just against harrassment and bullying, you're good.

again, i'm not exiling people for no reason.
parent.body_html:
the bread thing was an example lol. rules 3 and 4 are basically limited to posts, not comments, and rule 4 is basically just against harrassment and bullying, you're good.

post.body:
This guild seemed mostly to be a troll or throwaway guild, So it has been sieged.

A new design and rules have been set in place as well. Hopefully, this guild can become a decent place for genuine discussion and a safe haven for fellow trans people and allies.

Also, I'm looking for fellow people to share the guildmaster role with me. I won't be considering anyone who's post history I can't see for brigade protection reasons.
post.body_html:
This guild seemed mostly to be a troll or throwaway guild, So it has been sieged.

A new design and rules have been set in place as well. Hopefully, this guild can become a decent place for genuine discussion and a safe haven for fellow trans people and allies.

Also, I'm looking for fellow people to share the guildmaster role with me. I won't be considering anyone who's post history I can't see for brigade protection reasons.
post.title: +trans is under new management

Post whatever you notice (it doesn't have to be an important change, even changes in punctuation/spelling are ok)

If you want to be the GM of this guild, make a post here.

body:
Welcome to Ruqqus! If you'd like to discuss Ruqqus itself, check out +Ruqqus! If you'd like, you can also try checking out some of the settings of the site [here](https://ruqqus.com/settings). I hope you enjoy your stay here!

Note: If you don't like mod censorship, try to stay away from +TheMemery and +RealNews. They're modded by a notorious powermod, milkit, who frequently exiles (bans) users.

Second note: If you post in +general, your posts can get yanked to other guilds. Recently, a group of users have been yanking tons of posts into tiny guilds like +communism101. If that happens, you can remove your post from that guild by clicking the "Remove from +<guildname>" button.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
Welcome to Ruqqus! If you'd like to discuss Ruqqus itself, check out +Ruqqus! If you'd like, you can also try checking out some of the settings of the site here. I hope you enjoy your stay here!

Note: If you don't like mod censorship, try to stay away from +TheMemery and +RealNews. They're modded by a notorious powermod, milkit, who frequently exiles (bans) users.

Second note: If you post in +general, your posts can get yanked to other guilds. Recently, a group of users have been yanking tons of posts into tiny guilds like +cOmMUnISm101. If that happens, you can remove your post from that guild by clicking the "Remove from +<guildname>" button.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

post.body:
The discord invitation has been replaced with an OAuth2 application authorization which adds the user to the discord server. As we grow, this integration will allow us to offer improved service to users who contact us on Discord.

To get to Discord, just click here: https://ruqqus.com/discord

We also removed the announcements modal since it's basically been replaced by +changelog.
post.body_html:
The discord invitation has been replaced with an OAuth2 application authorization which adds the user to the discord server. As we grow, this integration will allow us to offer improved service to users who contact us on Discord.

To get to Discord, just click here: https://ruqqus.com/discord

We also removed the announcements modal since it's basically been replaced by +changelog.
post.title: Ruqqus 2.26 - Discord integration improvements

guild.description: A place to discuss suspended accounts. Also acts as a memorial.
guild.description_html: A place to discuss suspended accounts. Also acts as a memorial.
guild.name: uslashremoved

post.body:
[DGKSK8LIFE](https://ruqqus.com/@DGKSK8LIFE), banned for "staff impersonation" (I don't know when he was banned)

Note: I don't have the full story. I tried looking on the Discord, but that was after they had already hidden/deleted the old lounge channel, so there wasn't much I could find.

On discord, captainmeta4 says this in reply to a message by CrystalVulpine that I wasn't able to find.

>DGK was banned on ruqqus because they wrote in their ruqqus bio that they were a "member of the core ruqqus team". This is a very straightforward and clearcut violation of the ToS, which prohibits admin impersonation

According to Moister Banana#2942 on Discord, he said he was a part of the "Core Ruqqus Team", but he was not. According to CrystalVulpine, he *was* a part of the core ruqqus team. (I can't confirm what either of these users have said.)

CrystalVulpine said that he had "write access to the repo", and acikek said that "he technically was [an official ruqqus dev]" and that "the core ruqqus team was loosely defined anyways". Both these users say the real reason the admins wanted to ban him was because of fights they've had in the past.

Moister Banana#2942 says that he was asked to remove the section where he said he was a dev before getting banned, while [CrystalVulpine says that they barely gave him enough time to do it after he was removed from the dev team](https://ruqqus.com/+PoliticalCompassMemes/post/3whf/the-state-of-ruqqus/dfie).

(He was also apparently an edgelord, but that's irrelevant here.)

Either way, I don't know the full story, but it sounds like the ban was a bit too harsh, much like [the ban of jasonkhanlar](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/38lp/regarding-the-bans-of-jasonkhanlar-and). I don't think that this should have warranted a permanent ban from both Ruqqus and the Ruqqus Discord.
post.body_html:
DGKSK8LIFE, banned for "staff impersonation" (I don't know when he was banned)

Note: I don't have the full story. I tried looking on the Discord, but that was after they had already hidden/deleted the old lounge channel, so there wasn't much I could find.

On discord, captainmeta4 says this in reply to a message by CrystalVulpine that I wasn't able to find.

DGK was banned on ruqqus because they wrote in their ruqqus bio that they were a "member of the core ruqqus team". This is a very straightforward and clearcut violation of the ToS, which prohibits admin impersonation

According to Moister Banana#2942 on Discord, he said he was a part of the "Core Ruqqus Team", but he was not. According to CrystalVulpine, he was a part of the core ruqqus team. (I can't confirm what either of these users have said.)

CrystalVulpine said that he had "write access to the repo", and acikek said that "he technically was [an official ruqqus dev]" and that "the core ruqqus team was loosely defined anyways". Both these users say the real reason the admins wanted to ban him was because of fights they've had in the past.

Moister Banana#2942 says that he was asked to remove the section where he said he was a dev before getting banned, while CrystalVulpine says that they barely gave him enough time to do it after he was removed from the dev team.

(He was also apparently an edgelord, but that's irrelevant here.)

Either way, I don't know the full story, but it sounds like the ban was a bit too harsh, much like the ban of jasonkhanlar. I don't think that this should have warranted a permanent ban from both Ruqqus and the Ruqqus Discord.
post.title: @DGKSK8LIFE banned for "staff impersonation"

body:
I should probably ask the admins about this. I think that in the past, they've had an issue where the [slur filter was turned on for logged out users](https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/13az/ruqqus-is-now-quarantining-guilds-certain), and I think it was unintended.

@captainmeta4, it seems that the "hide politics" filter is turned on for logged out users. Is this intended? If it is, can you make it only apply to the "Home" page or have an off switch somewhere, and can you explicitly write on the page that the filter is on?
body_html:
I should probably ask the admins about this. I think that in the past, they've had an issue where the slur filter was turned on for logged out users, and I think it was unintended.

@captainmeta4, it seems that the "hide politics" filter is turned on for logged out users. Is this intended? If it is, can you make it only apply to the "Home" page or have an off switch somewhere, and can you explicitly write on the page that the filter is on?

guild.description:
Changes that aren't announced in +changelog or +ruqqus

Post whatever you notice (it doesn't have to be an important change, even changes in punctuation/spelling are ok)

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus

Update on 2021-01-29:

If you want to be the GM of this guild, make a post here.
guild.description_html:
Changes that aren't announced in +changelog or +Ruqqus

Post whatever you notice (it doesn't have to be an important change, even changes in punctuation/spelling are ok)

https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus

Update on 2021-01-29:

If you want to be the GM of this guild, make a post here.
guild.name: OtherChanges

post.body:
Edit: I forgot to mention that since the Home listing is the same as the Trending listing, they don't show up there either.

In other words, the "hide politics" filter, which filters posts based on this [keyword list](https://ruqqus.com/politics.txt), is turned on for logged out users.

This was not mentioned in +changelog. I don't know if it was intended or not.

**Edit 2: This was unintended. See @captainmeta4's comment.**
post.body_html:
Edit: I forgot to mention that since the Home listing is the same as the Trending listing, they don't show up there either.

In other words, the "hide politics" filter, which filters posts based on this keyword list, is turned on for logged out users.

This was not mentioned in +changelog. I don't know if it was intended or not.

Edit 2: This was unintended. See @captainmeta4's comment.
post.title: Posts containing "political content" no longer show up for logged out users in the All and Trending listings

post.title: And I saw when the Corgi opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four shitposts saying, Come and see.  And I saw.
